## Appendix A.b: 23.Q3: Increased Robustness of Small Downlink Data Transmissions

The feature enhancement increases the robustness of small downlink data transmissions

by converting padding bits to coding bits.

| Feature Name           | Scheduler Low-Band   | Scheduler Mid-Band   |
|------------------------|----------------------|----------------------|
| Feature Identity       | FAJ 121 5038         | FAJ 121 4906         |
| Value Package Name     | NR Base Package      | NR Base Package      |
| Value Package Identity | FAJ 801 4002         | FAJ 801 4002         |
| Node Type              | Baseband Radio Node  | Baseband Radio Node  |
| Access Type            | NR                   | NR                   |
| Impact at Upgrade      | Optional             | Optional             |

Summary and Benefits

Downlink resource allocation works with padding bits for small data transmissions,

which leads to high BLER for all services and high packet loss for VoNR. The feature

enhancement converts the padding bits to coding bits, which increases the robustness

of downlink small data transmissions. As a result, downlink HARQ BLER and VoNR

packet loss decrease.

As the MCS distribution is expected to shift from higher to lower bins, downlink MAC

cell throughput is expected to decrease without degrading user perception.

The feature enhancement has the following benefits on downlink:

- Packet loss for VoNR is expected to decrease.
- HARQ BLER is expected to decrease in average and lower modulations.
- Transport ratio is expected to increase for QPSK and 16-QAM.
- HARQ DTX rate for QPSK is expected to decrease.

Capacity and Performance

The feature enhancement decreases the following KPIs:

- Normalized Average DL MAC Cell Throughput Considering Traffic
- Normalized DL MAC Cell Throughput Considering Actual PDSCH Slot Only
- Average DL Throughput per NRCellDU
- DL Packet Loss Captured in gNodeB

The feature enhancement decreases the rate of unsuccessful HARQ transmissions and the

rate of unsuccessful discontinuous transmissions for QPSK due to the modulation

shift, which can be observed with the following PIs:

- DL HARQ BLER %
- DL HARQ DTX Rate for QPSK

MCS distribution shift from higher bins to lower bins can be monitored with the

following PM counters:

- NRCellDU.pmRadioPdschTable1McsDistr
- NRCellDU.pmRadioPdschTable2McsDistr

Downlink MAC volume transmitted in the secondary cell can decrease, which can be

monitored with the following PM counters:

- NRCellDU.pmMacVolDlSCell
- NRCellDU.pmMacVolDlSCellExt

Downlink MAC volume offloaded to the secondary cell can decrease, which can be

monitored with the following PM counters:

- NRCellDU.pmMacOffloadVolDlSCell
- NRCellDU.pmMacOffloadVolDlSCellExt

Downlink PDCP packet integrity is not expected to degrade, which can be monitored

with the following PM counters:

- RpUserPlaneLink.pmPdcpPktTransDlQos
- RpUserPlaneLink.pmPdcpPktTransDlAckQos

The feature enhancement might increase downlink MCG and SCG radio resource switching,

which might increase the following PM counters:

- GNBCUUPFunction.pmPdcpRadioResSwitchDlMcg
- GNBCUUPFunction.pmPdcpRadioResSwitchDlScg

This feature enhancement might increase the number of downlink RLC

retransmissions,which might increase the NRCellDU.pmRlcArqDlNack

PM counter.

Operation

The feature enhancement introduces the

NRCellDU.dlSmallDataRobustness attribute, which is used to

enable or disable the feature enhancement.

Hardware

No specific hardware requirements.

Interfaces

No impact.

Other Network Elements

It is recommended to use ENM version 23.2 or later to support the

MOM changes introduced by this feature enhancement. If the Release Independence

Manager application is used, the MOM changes are supported on earlier ENM versions

also.

Related Information

Scheduler Low-Band

Scheduler Mid-Band

## Appendix A.c: 23.Q3: Enhanced Uplink Power Control Configuration

The feature enhancement introduces attributes that simplify the PUSCH P0 value

adaptation.

| Feature Name           | Scheduler Low-Band   | Scheduler Mid-Band   |
|------------------------|----------------------|----------------------|
| Feature Identity       | FAJ 121 5038         | FAJ 121 4906         |
| Value Package Name     | NR Base Package      | NR Base Package      |
| Value Package Identity | FAJ 801 4002         | FAJ 801 4002         |
| Node Type              | Baseband Radio Node  | Baseband Radio Node  |
| Access Type            | NR                   | NR                   |
| Impact at Upgrade      | Optional             | Optional             |

Summary and Benefits

The feature enhancement enables the system to auto-select the PUSCH P0 nominal value

for each radio deployment. This simplifies the power control configuration.

Capacity and Performance

No impact.

Operation

The feature enhancement introduces the

NRCellDU.pmRadioPuschPwrSpectralDensityDistr PM counter.

The NRCellDU.pmRadioPathlossUlDistr PM counter is updated to

consider closed-loop power control adjustment.

The following attributes are introduced to enhance power control configurations:

- NRCellDU.autoSelectedModeOffset
- NRCellDU.pZeroNomPuschAutoSelected

A NRCellDU.pZeroNomPuschGrant

update is

updated with a new value that enables the system to auto-select

the value of the NRCellDU.pZeroNomPuschAutoSelected attribute to

match each radio deployment.

Interfaces

No impact.

Hardware

No specific hardware requirements.

Other Network Elements

It is recommended to use ENM version 23.2 or later to support the

MOM changes introduced by this feature enhancement. If the Release Independence

Manager application is used, the MOM changes are supported on earlier ENM versions

also.
